text: Last Page Text. SECOND BOOKOF THE HISTORY. 387 Section XCVII. (a) Hordeonios Flaccus was appointed by Galba to the command on the Upper Rhine, in the room of Verginius Rufus. See Appendix to Annals, xvi. s. 12. (I) For the war in which Flaccus was engaged with Civilis, the Batavian chief, see Hist. iv. s. 18. (c) Suetonius gives a different account of Vespasian's administration in Africa. In Vesp. s. 4. Section XCVIII. (a) For the Pannonian Alps, see the Geographical Table at the end of the Eighth Volume. SectionC. (a) Brotier thinks that there is a mistake in the text. The fourteenth legion, he observes, stood firm for Otho, find, for that reason, was sent into Britain. But per- haps the veterans, who had served their time, and were still retained in the service, were left in Italy. (b) For Hostilia, see the Geographical Table at the end of the Eighth Volume. Section CI. (a) That is, during the reigns of Vespasian, Titus,^nd Domitian, the last of the Flavian line. ENDOF THE FIFTH VOLUME. Printed by R. Taylor and Co. 38, Shoe-Lane, Fleet-Street.
